channel.title: Bloomberg Politics

item.title: Trump Says Aug. 1 Tariff Deadline Won’t Be Extended
item.description: President Donald Trump said he would not offer any extensions for the implementation of increased tariffs on many goods imported into the US, pledging that new rates would hit at the beginning of August.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Lai

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump Photographer: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Rubio Impostor Used AI, Signal to Contact Foreign Officials
item.description: Someone pretending to be Secretary of State Marco Rubio used AI-generated voice technology and a fake Signal account to contact foreign officials and at least one member of Congress, the latest case of impostors mimicking senior US officials.
item.dc:creator: Nick Wadhams

media:content.media:description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio

item.title: French Minister Feared Equity Trading Exodus to UK After Dividend Tax Rule Change
item.description: France’s finance minister said he feared a “mass exodus” of equity trading to London if he hadn’t provided clarity to banks about the application of new dividend tax rules.
item.dc:creator: Gaspard Sebag

media:content.media:description: France's finance minister Eric Lombard

item.title: EU to Protect Airbus in US Trade Deal as Ferrari Set to Lose Out
item.description: As the European Union nears a trade deal with the US, its negotiators are focusing on protecting key industries from massive tariffs set to hit the bloc’s exports as soon as Aug. 1.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Valero, Benedikt Kammel, Stefan Nicola

media:content.media:description: An aircraft assembled at an Airbus manufacturing plant.

item.title: Gambia Rejects New Constitution That Allows Barrow to Extend His Rule
item.description: Gambian lawmakers rejected a new draft constitution that imposed presidential term limits, but contained a loophole that would have allowed President Adama Barrow to run for re-election after his current five-year term ends in 2027.
item.dc:creator: Modou Joof

media:content.media:description: Adama Barrow

item.title: Solar Stocks Fall After Trump Orders Limit to Tax Credits
item.description: Shares of US solar companies fell after President Donald Trump called for new rules that would limit access to tax incentives for renewable energy projects that had already been pared back by a $3.4 trillion budget bill.
item.dc:creator: Mark Chediak

item.title: UK Officials Kept in Dark Over Issues Plaguing Economic Data
item.description: UK officials were kept in the dark over a crucial report detailing major cultural failings at the statistics body that contributed to the breakdown of official unemployment data.
item.dc:creator: Tom Rees

media:content.media:description: City workers in the financial district of London.

item.title: At Least Two Killed in Houthi Attack on Cargo Ship in Red Sea
item.description: A Houthi militant attack on a Liberian-flagged cargo ship in the Red Sea killed at least two crew members and left the vessel without propulsion in the latest sign that the Tehran-backed group is once again escalating its maritime assaults in the vital trade route.
item.dc:creator: Mohammed Hatem, Erik Olsson, Verity Ratcliffe, Catherine Cartier

media:content.media:description: The Magic Seas vessel.

item.title: Franco-German Rift Risks Dooming Next Fighter Jet, BDLI Says
item.description: A rift between French and German companies over control of a next-generation fighter jet risks dooming the project, Germany’s aviation lobby said, putting in doubt a marquee program just as the region fortifies its defense capabilities.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Kirchfeld, Benedikt Kammel

media:content.media:description: A model of an FCAS aircraft in Madrid.

item.title: US Immigration Curbs to Hit Economy Hard in 2025, Fed Study Says
item.description: The Trump administration’s curbs on immigration and ramped-up deportations will lower US economic growth by almost a full percentage point this year, according to a study from the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas.
item.dc:creator: Catarina Saraiva

media:content.media:description: A man says goodbye to a woman as Federal agents detain him following an immigration court hearing at Jacob K. Javits Federal Building in New York, on June 10. Photographer: Adam Gray/Getty Images

item.title: Treasury Secretary Bessent to Visit Japan Next Week for Expo
item.description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent is planning to visit Japan next week for the 2025 World Expo in Osaka, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Erica Yokoyama, Takashi Umekawa

media:content.media:description: Scott Bessent, US treasury secretary, during a news conference in the James S. Brady Press Briefing Room of the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Friday, June 27, 2025. President Trump says the US has made a trade deal with “probably four or five different countries,” naming agreements with China and the UK.

item.title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa Sees Room to Cut US Tariff in Talks
item.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said there’s the prospect that the US may lower a planned 30% tariff on goods in ongoing talks with Washington, as he challenged its calculation of the new levy.
item.dc:creator: S'thembile Cele

item.title: Philadelphia Trash Piles Up as Garbage Workers’ Strike Drags On
item.description: Philadelphia’s streets and sidewalks are piling up with garbage after the union of municipal employees went on strike in a city that is already facing acute budget pressures.
item.dc:creator: Sri Taylor

media:content.media:description: Trash piles line a road in Philadelphia on July 7. Photographer: Tassanee Vejpongsa/AP Photo

item.title: Brazil’s Lula Hosts Modi in Bid to Turn India Into a Major Trade Partner
item.description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva wants to deepen trade ties with India, the world’s most populous nation. The question as he prepares to host Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Brasilia on Tuesday is how to go about it.
item.dc:creator: Simone Iglesias, Daniel Carvalho

media:content.media:description: Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, left, and Narendra Modi, India’s prime minister

item.title: US Acts Against Foreign Ownership of Farmland Amid China Tension
item.description: The Trump administration is tightening its grip on foreign ownership of farmland amid continuing concerns over Chinese investment in America’s heartland.
item.dc:creator: Ilena Peng

media:content.media:description: Agricultural land near Denver, Colorado, US, on Saturday, Aug. 19, 2023. Some $5 trillion of capital investment may be needed to deliver on aviation's goal of reaching carbon neutrality by 2050, almost all of it plowed into sustainable fuel production and renewable power generation, according to McKinsey & Co. Photographer: Bing Guan/Bloomberg

item.title: Budget Watchdog Warns on UK Welfare Costs After Policy U-Turns
item.description: Britain’s budget watchdog warned of a £12 billion ($16.3 billion) blow to Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves from higher welfare spending if the government fails to get a handle on soaring health benefits.
item.dc:creator: Tom Rees

media:content.media:description: Rachel Reeves and Keir Starmer Photographer: Jacob King/Getty Images

item.title: EU Gives Final Nod to Bulgaria’s Euro-Zone Entry Next Year
item.description: Bulgaria is set to become the 21st member of the euro zone next year after European Union finance ministers signed off on its bid on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Slav Okov

item.title: UK Doctors Vote in Favor of New Strikes in Setback to Starmer
item.description: UK doctors voted overwhelmingly in favor of fresh strikes over pay in the latest setback to Prime Minister Keir Starmer less than a year after the Labour government awarded them a sizable wage increase to end a previous round of damaging industrial action.
item.dc:creator: Alex Morales

media:content.media:description: Junior doctors strike on a picket line in London, in 2024. Photographer: Carlos Jasso/Bloomberg

item.title: Russia’s Crude Shipments Slide to the Lowest Since February
item.description: Refining runs are rising faster than production, eating into exports
item.dc:creator: Julian Lee

media:content.media:description: Russia shipped about 3.12 million barrels a day in the four weeks to July 6.

item.title: Latest Tariff Pause Shows Limits of Trump’s Frenzied Dealmaking
item.description: On “Liberation Day” on April 2, Donald Trump gushed about how trade was finally going to tilt in America’s favor after decades of its workers and companies being “plundered.” For the president, unfettered tariffs would soon make the US “an entirely different country.”
item.dc:creator: Jenny Leonard

item.title: UN Criticizes Lethal Force in Kenya That Killed 15 Protesters
item.description: The United Nations denounced the use of lethal force in clashes between Kenyan police and protesters, which killed least 15 people, saying those responsible must be held to account.
item.dc:creator: Rene Vollgraaff

media:content.media:description: Police remove tires from barricades during clashes with protesters in Nairobi on July 7.

item.title: Germany Summons Chinese Envoy After Laser Targeted Plane
item.description: Germany summoned China’s ambassador over accusations that a military plane was endangered by a Chinese warship.
item.dc:creator: Michael Nienaber, Arne Delfs

media:content.media:description: A German Navy maritime surveillance aircraft.

item.title: Deadly Telecom Blaze Shuts Cairo Stock Trading and Hits Internet
item.description: A blaze at a key downtown Cairo telephone exchange left at least four people dead and another 27 injured, cutting off network services and forcing the local stock exchange to cancel Tuesday’s trading session.
item.dc:creator: Tarek El-Tablawy

media:content.media:description: Firefighters tackle a blaze at a a key telephone exchange in Cairo on July 8. Photographer: Amr Nabil/AP Photo

item.title: EU Chief Demands China Address Trade Imbalance as Tensions Flare
item.description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen accused China of distorting trade and limiting access for European firms two weeks ahead of a summit between the economic powers.
item.dc:creator: Michal Kubala, Max Ramsay

media:content.media:description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen Photographer: Jean-Christophe Verhaegen/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Trump Seeks an Elusive Peace Dividend in Gaza
item.description: Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu nominated Trump for a Nobel prize.
item.dc:creator: Dan Williams

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump, center left, and Benjamin Netanyahu, Israel's prime minister, center right, during a dinner in the Blue Room of the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, July 7, 2025. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told President Donald Trump he nominated him for the Nobel Peace Prize, using a visit to the White House to further cement the pair's relationship as the US presses for a ceasefire in Gaza. Photographer: Al Drago/Bloomberg

item.title: US Mental Health Jobs Boom Faces Sudden Stop as Trump Cuts Funds
item.description: Mental health providers, the fastest-growing industry in the US since the start of the pandemic, risk a sharp reversal of fortune as President Donald Trump seeks to eliminate billions of dollars in funding that enabled their expansion.
item.dc:creator: Maria Clara Cobo, Nazmul Ahasan

item.title: German Finance Chief Says Putin Threat Justifies Defense Buildup
item.description: Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil justified Germany’s massive ramp-up in military spending by arguing it’s essential to face down the threat from Vladimir Putin’s Russia and prevent German children ever having to experience war.
item.dc:creator: Kamil Kowalcze

media:content.media:description: Lars Klingbeil in the Bundestag in Berlin on July 8.

item.title: El misterioso asesor que maneja redes, discursos y poder en la Argentina de Javier Milei
item.description: Fanático de “The West Wing” y enemigo acérrimo de todo lo “woke”, Santiago Caputo revoluciona la política argentina.
item.dc:creator: Manuela Tobias

media:content.media:description: ONE TIME USAGE ONLY. Casa Rosada Santiago Caputo Argentina Foto Federico Lopez Claro

item.title: Milei’s Secret Weapon Is an Anti-Woke Devotee of ‘The West Wing’
item.description: Santiago Caputo is upending Argentine politics amid rumored tension with the libertarian president’s sister ahead of a crucial midterm vote.
item.dc:creator: Manuela Tobias

media:content.media:description: Tattoos peek through Santiago Caputo’s sleeves outside the Casa Rosada in Buenos Aires.

item.title: Rubio Heads to Malaysia for Summit Under Shadow of Tariffs
item.description: Marco Rubio is making his first trip to Asia as the top US diplomat, heading to a summit in Malaysia a day after President Donald Trump again threatened to slam the region with high tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Eric Martin, Philip Heijmans

media:content.media:description: Signage for the 46th Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) Summit in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Photographer: He Guowei/VCG/Getty Images
